content.description: Start at the far left of the good ledge that makes up the whales mouth. Smear feet and traverse right using pockets and slopers on the right corner to top out. (Same top out as Sweet Mouth)
content.location: The Whale Boulder (Riverside Drive/Buttermilk trail) - From 42nd street parking lot, head left (west) on the trail following Riverside Drive (not over the foot bridge). The boulder will be just past the 2nd stream crossing on the left between the trail and Riverside Drive. It is right next to the trail with just enough room for a few pads that arent in the way of the hikers and bikers.

content.description: Sit start at the far left of the boulder using pockets for hands and low rails for feet. Traverse right on horizontal crack, then go up the vertical crack to top out.
content.location: The Whale Boulder (Riverside Drive/Buttermilk trail) - From 42nd street parking lot, head left (west) on the trail following Riverside Drive (not over the foot bridge). The boulder will be just past the 2nd stream crossing on the left between the trail and Riverside Drive. It is right next to the trail with just enough room for a few pads that arent in the way of the hikers and bikers.

content.description: Stand start in the middle of the juggy horizontal crack, left of the vertical one. Go straight up to top out.
content.location: The Whale Boulder (Riverside Drive/Buttermilk trail) - From 42nd street parking lot, head left (west) on the trail following Riverside Drive (not over the foot bridge). The boulder will be just past the 2nd stream crossing on the left between the trail and Riverside Drive. It is right next to the trail with just enough room for a few pads that arent in the way of the hikers and bikers.

content.description: Start  right hand on flake, left hand sidepull (arete) with crappy left foot smear on granular granite dish (right foot flag). Tense body to stay on (without jumping right off the bat) and throw hard with right hand for pebble on top of boulder, suffer through the match, get high feet and finish.   Sit start begins matched on slash in middle of boulder and makes one extra move to the sidepull in order to get a highfoot for the throw (probably around V7 with the low start)
content.location: riverside drive directly below the overlook, (take a right onto riverside after crossing the nickel bridge continue about a mile you will see boulder from road. perfect slappy granite

content.description: In no seriousness, Grab the meaty crimp on the left and the arête on the right. Now paste your sticky rubber on the bomber crystal... you don't see it? Now pull off the ground and make the move to the lip. If you made it, well done. If not, I'm sure you look great with a Nelly band-aid.
content.location: Left side of the Walker Texas Ranger arête.

content.description: Stand start at the far left end of the large upper crack on slopers. Traverse right using sloping lip for hands. Top out at the vertical crack.
content.location: The Whale Boulder (Riverside Drive/Buttermilk trail) - From 42nd street parking lot, head left (west) on the trail following Riverside Drive (not over the foot bridge). The boulder will be just past the 2nd stream crossing on the left between the trail and Riverside Drive. It is right next to the trail with just enough room for a few pads that arent in the way of the hikers and bikers.

content.description: Start with hands on the low thin seam right of the vertical crack. Traverse right along the seam to the good ledge. Go straight up the bulging prow using tough sloping dishes and finish the difficult mantle. (Same top out as Short Nothings)
content.protection: At least 2 pads and a good spotter. More pads are encouraged.
content.location: The Whale Boulder (Riverside Drive/Buttermilk trail) - From 42nd street parking lot, head left (west) on the trail following Riverside Drive (not over the foot bridge). The boulder will be just past the 2nd stream crossing on the left between the trail and Riverside Drive. It is right next to the trail with just enough room for a few pads that arent in the way of the hikers and bikers.

content.description: Start with hands on the low thin seam right of the vertical crack. Traverse right along the seam to the good ledge. At the good ledge finish right on good holds. (Same top out as Whales Mouth)
content.location: The Whale Boulder (Riverside Drive/Buttermilk trail) - From 42nd street parking lot, head left (west) on the trail following Riverside Drive (not over the foot bridge). The boulder will be just past the 2nd stream crossing on the left between the trail and Riverside Drive. It is right next to the trail with just enough room for a few pads that arent in the way of the hikers and bikers.

content.description: Start on the low right side of boulder with good right foot on small incut, move left towards the middle of boulder via the slappy features atop it.  After two moves compress shoulders and throw your foot onto middle seam, top out
content.location: Riverside Drive (the other side of walker texas ranger)

content.description: Start at the good ledge that makes up the whales mouth. Go straight up the bulging prow using tough sloping dishes and finish the difficult mantle. (Same top out as Sweet Nothings)
content.protection: At least 2 pads and a good spotter.
content.location: The Whale Boulder (Riverside Drive/Buttermilk trail) - From 42nd street parking lot, head left (west) on the trail following Riverside Drive (not over the foot bridge). The boulder will be just past the 2nd stream crossing on the left between the trail and Riverside Drive. It is right next to the trail with just enough room for a few pads that arent in the way of the hikers and bikers.

content.description: Sit start same as for "Jurassic park arête," but continue right on slopers to finish on the good top rail of "Coffee is my cologne," top out.   This adds a few more moves on slopers and an exciting finish to the rail. Have Fun!
content.location: Lower trail just west of 42nd street foot bridge by the railroad tracks.

content.description: Sit start on shelf and left hand on arete left foot on incut, move into a heel hook and bump hand further up arete with right thumb catch.    next move right hand to sloper and left out to shelf, double mantle and top out left of previously established problems.  awesome
content.location: Located below main cluster on buttermilk trail

content.description: Start with hands on the low thin seam right of the vertical crack. Go straight up to high crimps on small seam. Use the sloper and nearby pocket, then reach to a mono crystal and top out the slopey lip.
content.location: The Whale Boulder (Riverside Drive/Buttermilk trail) - From 42nd street parking lot, head left (west) on the trail following Riverside Drive (not over the foot bridge). The boulder will be just past the 2nd stream crossing on the left between the trail and Riverside Drive. It is right next to the trail with just enough room for a few pads that arent in the way of the hikers and bikers.

content.description: Tensiony start with right hand on obvious right-facing sidepull in center of face at waist height, left on small crimp flake inches above. Find feet in small seem and move up to bumpy sloper. Find feet on ledge way out right and reach for good edge up high. Top out straight up, same as Biker Crack.
content.location: Start in the center of the slab right of "Biker Arête."

content.description: Stand start with right foot smear on shelf and right hand on sidepull left on raptor claw crimp.  Throw to small pinch with pebble further up right hand arete, set feet and throw too small knobish sloper, bump to good shelf at apex and finish.
content.location: located on same bouder as jurrasic park arete

content.description: Sit start with hands on low sidepull and a thin foot. Shoot right to the rail and climb sidepulls and edges to the top. Top out is a little dirty but with good holds.
content.location: Biker Boulders - From 42nd street parking lot, head left (west) on the trail following Riverside Drive (not over the foot bridge). The boulder will be past the whale boulder by a couple minutes walking. It is right next to the trail. Your pads will be in the way of the bikers, so keep an eye and ear open for them coming. Hikers should have enough room to get by.

content.description: Sit start the arête. Work the sidepulls and pinches up to the rounded lip. Be careful if attempting the top out, it is generally very dirty.
content.protection: At least 1 pad and a spotter.
content.location: Biker Boulders - From 42nd street parking lot, head left (west) on the trail following Riverside Drive (not over the foot bridge). The boulder will be past the whale boulder by a couple minutes walking. It is right next to the trail. Your pads will be in the way of the bikers, so keep an eye and ear open for them coming. Hikers should have enough room to get by.

content.description: Layback start on flat sidepull rail a few feet right of the arête. Move up through crimps to a big reach left. Top out same as Biker Arete. Jezzery can be found to aid the reach but bringing your 6 foot wingspan wont hurt either.
content.location: Start on obvious flat sidepull on the slab right of "Biker Arête".

content.description: Good bouldering in and along riverside drive.
